page.title: 11A FAMOUS BUILDING IN ALVA
page.content: Apart from the Ochil Hills,Strude Mill is the most important feature in the Alva{landscape.}It stands at the north of the town close to the Alva Glen.It is a tall narrow building.It has 326 windows,150 at the front,150 at the back 18 on the side and 8 on the roof. All the windows were used for letting in the light because it was designed for the hand-loom{weaving industry.}It was built in 1798 and was used until recently for making woollen goods.It has 6 floors.A building firm now wants to turn it into flats,but as the{arch- {itecture}is important it has to be done without changing the outside of the mill.
